section.description: This tutorial is intended to help new users of Alpha Anywhere to develop fully functional web database applications. The underlying assumption of this tutorial is that you have Alpha Anywhere and the AlphaSports sample database.

section.title: Errors and Comments
section.description: If you find errors in this tutorial or want to provide comments to the author, click on the link at the bottom of any page and send an email message with your thoughts.

section.title: Conventions Used in this Tutorial
section.description: When you create a page that the Application Server will process and send to a remote Internet connected user, initially the page will contain both standard HTML and Javascript code, and special Xbasic code that allows the user to interact with the Application Server. To distinguish these types of code, the samples presented here will show the HTML and Javascript in brown, and the Xbasic in blue, as illustrated below.
section.example:
<%a5 dim favorite_color as C %>

What is your favorite color?

You picked <%a5 ? favorite_color %>
